definition: (of an actor) to remove makeup and costume/(computing) to uninstall/to unmount
to unload/to unhitch/to remove or strip/to get rid of
adornment/to adorn/dress/clothing/costume (of an actor in a play)/to play a role/to pretend/to install/to fix/to wrap (sth in a bag)/to load/to pack

sentences.english: There is still a lot of software that comes without an uninstall program.
sentences.chinese: 仍然有很多软件是没有卸装程序的。

sentences.english: Library loading and unloading introduces some issues, such as the need to take care of static objects.
sentences.chinese: 库装入和卸装引入一些问题，如需要注意静态对象。

sentences.english: The actor is bidden to undress, and wash off his powder and paint; he will be needed no more.
sentences.chinese: 演员奉命卸装，洗去粉墨胭脂，再也用不着他了。

sentences.english: Examples include file systems being unmounted or Fibre Channel adapters being disconnected.
sentences.chinese: 文件系统遭卸装或光纤通道适配器被断开连接。

sentences.english: The actors were all dressing, talking, hurrying about.
sentences.chinese: 演员们都在卸装穿衣交谈，匆匆走来走去。

definition: to unload/to unhitch/to remove or strip/to get rid of
to remove makeup/(old) to take off formal dress and ornaments
to apply (ointment, powder)/to smear/to paint on
(of a woman) to adorn oneself/makeup/adornment/trousseau/stage makeup and costume
Nivea, skin and body care brand
